result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton C. Haase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Called cases 15CF187 and 14CF264. Defendant Colton C. Haase in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mayer heard regarding agreement. Court reviews charges, penalties and rights. Def pleads NC to Bail Jumping w/o enhancer in case 15CF187. Court reviews PQ&WOR, finds plea made FV&I, accepts plea and finds def guilty of bail jumping w/o enhancer in case 15CF187. All counts in case 14CF264 are DRI.  Victim rights compliance. Atty Sempf heard. Atty Mayer heard. Def makes stmnt. Court heard and imposes sent of:

6 yrs DOC - Imposed and Stayed consecutive
3 yrs IC
3yrs ES

3 yrs P&P consecutive
Restitution of $2092.65 to Marshland Pharmacy
costs
NOH for P/S sent to Defendant at DCDF

Defendant Colton C. Haase in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Colton C. Haase in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. State heard on bond: $5000 cash, wants cash frozen in 14CF264; Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 6/4/15 at 3pm in Br. 4; Court sets $2,000 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
